required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) in Patients With Advanced 'Triple-negative' Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for Advanced 'Triple-negative' Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine whether the investigational drug dasatinib is effective in treatment of women with progressive advanced triple-negative breast cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study drug therapy (up to 65 weeks).
primary_outcome.description: Tumor response was defined as the number of participants whose best response was CR or PR, per the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECIST): CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >= 30% decrease in the sum of the LDs of target lesions relative to the baseline sum LD.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study drug therapy (up to 65 weeks).
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants whose best response was CR or PR, per the RECIST: CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >= 30% decrease in the sum of the LDs of target lesions relative to the baseline sum LD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) at or After 16 Weeks on Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 16 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants whose best response was CR, PR or SD (per the RECIST) at or after 16 weeks on study: CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >=30% decrease in the sum of the LDs of target lesions relative to baseline sum LD; SD: neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD; PD: appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) at or After 16 Weeks on Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants whose best response was CR, PR or SD (per the RECIST) at or after 16 weeks on study: CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >=30% decrease in the sum of the LDs of target lesions relative to baseline sum LD; SD: neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD; PD: appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Progression-Free Survival (PFS) at Weeks 9, 17, and 25
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 9, 17, and 25
secondary_outcome.description: PFS:time from first dose until the date that progressive disease (PD) or clinical PD (cPD) observed,per RECIST criteria.PD:appearance of new lesion/s,or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions,relative to smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start,or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions;cPD:deterioration related to disease requiring treatment discontinuation,but without radiographic PD.Participants who died without PD were considered to have PD on the date of death.For participants who neither progressed nor died,date of the last tumor assessment was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Weeks of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study drug therapy (up to 53.86 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean number of weeks of CR/PR (time from first date of CR/PR until first date PD observed. Tumor response defined per RECIST: CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >=30% decrease in sum of LDs of target lesions relative to baseline sum LD; PD: appearance of new lesion or >=20% increase in sum of LD of target lesions relative to smallest sum LD or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions. Participants who died without reported PD were considered to have PD on date of death. For participants who neither progressed nor died, date of last tumor assessment used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Plasma Concentration at Week 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-dose and 1, 3, 6 and 12 hours after each dose administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean plasma concentration was obtained directly from the concentration-time data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Plasma Concentration at Week 7
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-dose and 1, 3, 6 and 12 hours after each dose administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean plasma concentration was obtained directly from the concentration-time data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Concentration of Collagen Type IV From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 3 and Week 5
secondary_outcome.description: Collagen Type IV is a measure of anti-angiogenic activity. Plasma samples for assessment of change in concentration of Collagen Type IV were obtained and analyzed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Concentration of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor-2 (VEGFR2) From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 3 and Week 5
secondary_outcome.description: VEGFR2 is a measure of anti-angiogenic activity. Plasma samples for assessment of change in concentration of VEGFR2 were obtained and analyzed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Tumor Biomarkers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor markers are indicators of tumor activity which may be used to predict clinical benefit and circulating biomarkers may reveal key mechanisms of action. Tissue staining was performed for caveolin, phospho-caveolin, EphA2 and insulin-like growth factor binding protein 2 (IGFBP2) markers using immunohistochemistry assays.

secondary_outcome.measure: Profiling of Messenger-ribonucleic Acid (mRNA) Expression: mRNA Signal Intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacogenomic analysis included the assessment of the relationship between clinical benefit and mRNA expression levels and between clinical benefit and protein phosphorylation. Tumor mRNA expression was analyzed in all available tissues. mRNA was extracted from 96 formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue (FFPET) samples, amplified, and fluorescently labeled. Gene expression profiling was conducted using Affymetrix Human Genome U133A 2.0 DNA microarrays. mRNA expression is reported as quantile normalized RMA values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died, Experienced Other Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) or Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition (even if not caused by the study drug). An SAE was defined as an AE that resulted in death, was life-threatening, required hospitalization (or prolongation of existing hospitalization), or was an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced Drug-related SAEs, Drug-related AEs, Drug-related Grade 3 AEs and Discontinuations Due to Drug-related AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of pre-existing medical condition.SAE=AE that resulted in death, was life-threatening, required hospitalization (or prolongation of existing hospitalization), or was an important medical event. Drug-related SAEs or AEs are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable or possible.AEs were graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Toxicity Criteria (CTC), v3: Grade 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe, 4=life threatening, 5=death.Participants who discontinued the study due to any drug-related AEs were also recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Most Frequent Drug-related Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Most frequent drug-related AEs are those AEs with frequency >=25% in either group. Drug-related AEs are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable or possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Abnormalities in Hematology Measurements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grades 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Granulocytes: Grade 3 <1.0 - 0.5 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <0.5 x 10^9/L. Hemoglobin: Grade 3, <8.0 - 6.5 g/dL; Grade 4, <6.5 g/dL. Platelets: Grade 3, <50.0 - 25.0 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <25.0 x 10^9/L. Leukocytes: Grade 3, <2.0 - 1.0 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <1.0 x 10^9/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormalities (Grade 1 or 2) in Prothrombin Time (PT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: PT is a measure of the clotting ability of the blood. Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1=mild, Grade 2=moderate, Grade 3=severe, Grade 4=life-threatening and 5=death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormalities (Grade 1 or 2) in Partial Thromboplastin Time (PTT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: PTT is a measure of the clotting ability of the blood. Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1=mild, Grade 2=moderate, Grade 3=severe, Grade 4=life-threatening and 5=death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST) and Alkaline Phosphatase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: ALT, AST and alkaline phosphatase: Grade 3: >5-20 x upper limit of normal (ULN), Grade 4: >20 x ULN.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Calcium, Potassium, Magnesium and Sodium
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Calcium: Grade 3-4 : <6.0 - <7.0 or >12.5 - >13.5 mg/dL, Potassium: Grade 3-4 : <2.5 - <3.0 or >6.0 - >7.0 mEq/L, Magnesium: Grade 3-4 : <0.6 - <0.8 or >2.46 - >6.6 mEq/L, Sodium:< 120- 130 or >155 - >160 mEq/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Creatinine, Bicarbonate, Inorganic Phosphorous and Bilirubin (Total).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Creatinine: Grade 3-4 : > 3.0 -6.0 ULN (upper limit of normal),Bicarbonate: Grade 3-4: <16 -<22 mEq/L, Phosphorous: Grade 3-4 : <1.0 - <2.0 mg/dL, Bilirubin, total: Grade 3-4: >3.0 - >10.0 ULN.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Identified Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 3, 9, 17 and 25, then every 8 weeks until the end of study treatment (up to 17 weeks).
secondary_outcome.description: ECGs were performed and all recordings were evaluated by the investigator. Abnormalities, if present at any study time point, were listed. The following ECG variables were collected: heart rate, PR interval, QRS width, and QT interval. Abnormalities in ECGs were defined by reference to institutional reports.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Vital Signs Measurements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each study visit (Week 3, 5, 7, 9, 13, 17 and 25) and end of treatment (up to 17 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Vital signs included systolic and diastolic blood pressure and heart rate. The investigator used his or her judgement to decide whether or not the values were abnormal.

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 100 mg, twice daily as long as the patient benefits (avg <6 months)
Tablets, Oral, 70 mg, twice daily as long as the patient benefits (avg <6 months)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- females, 18 or older
- recurrent or progressive locally advanced, or 'triple negative' metastatic breast cancer
- paraffin-embedded tissue block must be available
- measurable disease
- prior chemotherapy with an anthracycline, a taxane, or both (neoadjuvant, adjuvant, or metastatic setting)
- 0, 1 or 2 chemotherapies in the metastatic setting
- adequate organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Metastatic disease confined to bone only
- Symptomatic CNS metastasis
- Concurrent medical condition which may increase the risk of toxicity
- Unable to take oral medication

facility.name: University Of Texas Md Anderson Cancer Ctr

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

clinical_study.keyword: Recurrent, locally-advanced, or 'triple negative' metastatic breast cancer

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 55 participants were enrolled in the study; 11 discontinued prior to study drug administration (8 no longer met study criteria, 2 other reasons and 1 administrative reason by the sponsor)

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

participants_list.participants: Number of participants remained on study till the study drug could be tolerated
Number of participants remained on study till the study drug could be tolerated

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Adverse event unrelated to study drug

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
outcome.description: Tumor response was defined as the number of participants whose best response was CR or PR, per the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECIST): CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >= 30% decrease in the sum of the LDs of target lesions relative to the baseline sum LD.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study drug therapy (up to 65 weeks).
outcome.population: All response-evaluable participants i.e. all treated participants who had at least 1 measurable lesion at baseline, had at least 1 on-study tumor assessment or discontinued before any on-study tumor assessment for reasons related to disease or study drug.

outcome.title: Mean Plasma Concentration at Week 3
outcome.description: Mean plasma concentration was obtained directly from the concentration-time data.
outcome.time_frame: At pre-dose and 1, 3, 6 and 12 hours after each dose administration
outcome.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacokinetic analysis. "n" signifies the number of participants evaluable at each time point.

measure.title: Mean Plasma Concentration at Week 3
measure.description: Mean plasma concentration was obtained directly from the concentration-time data.
measure.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacokinetic analysis. "n" signifies the number of participants evaluable at each time point.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
outcome.description: The percentage of participants whose best response was CR or PR, per the RECIST: CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >= 30% decrease in the sum of the LDs of target lesions relative to the baseline sum LD.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study drug therapy (up to 65 weeks).
outcome.population: All response-evaluable participants i.e. all treated participants who had at least 1 measurable lesion at baseline, 1 on-study tumor assessment or discontinued before any on-study tumor assessment for reasons related to disease or study drug were included in this dataset.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
measure.description: The percentage of participants whose best response was CR or PR, per the RECIST: CR: disappearance of all target/non-target lesions; PR: >= 30% decrease in the sum of the LDs of target lesions relative to the baseline sum LD.
measure.population: All response-evaluable participants i.e. all treated participants who had at least 1 measurable lesion at baseline, 1 on-study tumor assessment or discontinued before any on-study tumor assessment for reasons related to disease or study drug were included in this dataset.

outcome.title: Mean Plasma Concentration at Week 7
outcome.description: Mean plasma concentration was obtained directly from the concentration-time data.
outcome.time_frame: At pre-dose and 1, 3, 6 and 12 hours after each dose administration
outcome.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacokinetic analysis. "n" signifies the number of participants evaluable at each time point.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Mean Plasma Concentration at Week 7
measure.description: Mean plasma concentration was obtained directly from the concentration-time data.
measure.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacokinetic analysis. "n" signifies the number of participants evaluable at each time point.

outcome.title: Mean Change in Concentration of Collagen Type IV From Baseline
outcome.description: Collagen Type IV is a measure of anti-angiogenic activity. Plasma samples for assessment of change in concentration of Collagen Type IV were obtained and analyzed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 3 and Week 5
outcome.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacodynamic analysis.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Mean Change in Concentration of Collagen Type IV From Baseline
measure.description: Collagen Type IV is a measure of anti-angiogenic activity. Plasma samples for assessment of change in concentration of Collagen Type IV were obtained and analyzed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
measure.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacodynamic analysis.

outcome.title: Mean Change in Concentration of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor-2 (VEGFR2) From Baseline
outcome.description: VEGFR2 is a measure of anti-angiogenic activity. Plasma samples for assessment of change in concentration of VEGFR2 were obtained and analyzed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 3 and Week 5
outcome.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacodynamic analysis.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Mean Change in Concentration of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor-2 (VEGFR2) From Baseline
measure.description: VEGFR2 is a measure of anti-angiogenic activity. Plasma samples for assessment of change in concentration of VEGFR2 were obtained and analyzed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
measure.population: Participants who were evaluable for pharmacodynamic analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Tumor Biomarkers
outcome.description: Tumor markers are indicators of tumor activity which may be used to predict clinical benefit and circulating biomarkers may reveal key mechanisms of action. Tissue staining was performed for caveolin, phospho-caveolin, EphA2 and insulin-like growth factor binding protein 2 (IGFBP2) markers using immunohistochemistry assays.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: All treated participants who were evaluable for the analysis. These data for tumor markers were integrated with those from other studies and are not reportable for this study alone.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Percentage Change in Tumor Biomarkers
measure.description: Tumor markers are indicators of tumor activity which may be used to predict clinical benefit and circulating biomarkers may reveal key mechanisms of action. Tissue staining was performed for caveolin, phospho-caveolin, EphA2 and insulin-like growth factor binding protein 2 (IGFBP2) markers using immunohistochemistry assays.
measure.population: All treated participants who were evaluable for the analysis. These data for tumor markers were integrated with those from other studies and are not reportable for this study alone.

outcome.title: Profiling of Messenger-ribonucleic Acid (mRNA) Expression: mRNA Signal Intensity
outcome.description: Pharmacogenomic analysis included the assessment of the relationship between clinical benefit and mRNA expression levels and between clinical benefit and protein phosphorylation. Tumor mRNA expression was analyzed in all available tissues. mRNA was extracted from 96 formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue (FFPET) samples, amplified, and fluorescently labeled. Gene expression profiling was conducted using Affymetrix Human Genome U133A 2.0 DNA microarrays. mRNA expression is reported as quantile normalized RMA values.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: All treated participants who were evaluable for the analysis. These data for pharmacogenomic analyses were integrated with those from other studies and are not reportable for this study alone.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Profiling of Messenger-ribonucleic Acid (mRNA) Expression: mRNA Signal Intensity
measure.description: Pharmacogenomic analysis included the assessment of the relationship between clinical benefit and mRNA expression levels and between clinical benefit and protein phosphorylation. Tumor mRNA expression was analyzed in all available tissues. mRNA was extracted from 96 formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue (FFPET) samples, amplified, and fluorescently labeled. Gene expression profiling was conducted using Affymetrix Human Genome U133A 2.0 DNA microarrays. mRNA expression is reported as quantile normalized RMA values.
measure.population: All treated participants who were evaluable for the analysis. These data for pharmacogenomic analyses were integrated with those from other studies and are not reportable for this study alone.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Died, Experienced Other Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) or Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition (even if not caused by the study drug). An SAE was defined as an AE that resulted in death, was life-threatening, required hospitalization (or prolongation of existing hospitalization), or was an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Died, Experienced Other Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) or Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition (even if not caused by the study drug). An SAE was defined as an AE that resulted in death, was life-threatening, required hospitalization (or prolongation of existing hospitalization), or was an important medical event.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced Drug-related SAEs, Drug-related AEs, Drug-related Grade 3 AEs and Discontinuations Due to Drug-related AEs
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of pre-existing medical condition.SAE=AE that resulted in death, was life-threatening, required hospitalization (or prolongation of existing hospitalization), or was an important medical event. Drug-related SAEs or AEs are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable or possible.AEs were graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Toxicity Criteria (CTC), v3: Grade 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe, 4=life threatening, 5=death.Participants who discontinued the study due to any drug-related AEs were also recorded.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced Drug-related SAEs, Drug-related AEs, Drug-related Grade 3 AEs and Discontinuations Due to Drug-related AEs
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of pre-existing medical condition.SAE=AE that resulted in death, was life-threatening, required hospitalization (or prolongation of existing hospitalization), or was an important medical event. Drug-related SAEs or AEs are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable or possible.AEs were graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Toxicity Criteria (CTC), v3: Grade 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe, 4=life threatening, 5=death.Participants who discontinued the study due to any drug-related AEs were also recorded.

outcome.title: Most Frequent Drug-related Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Most frequent drug-related AEs are those AEs with frequency >=25% in either group. Drug-related AEs are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable or possible.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Most Frequent Drug-related Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Most frequent drug-related AEs are those AEs with frequency >=25% in either group. Drug-related AEs are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable or possible.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Abnormalities in Hematology Measurements
outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grades 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Granulocytes: Grade 3 <1.0 - 0.5 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <0.5 x 10^9/L. Hemoglobin: Grade 3, <8.0 - 6.5 g/dL; Grade 4, <6.5 g/dL. Platelets: Grade 3, <50.0 - 25.0 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <25.0 x 10^9/L. Leukocytes: Grade 3, <2.0 - 1.0 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <1.0 x 10^9/L.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Abnormalities in Hematology Measurements
measure.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grades 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Granulocytes: Grade 3 <1.0 - 0.5 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <0.5 x 10^9/L. Hemoglobin: Grade 3, <8.0 - 6.5 g/dL; Grade 4, <6.5 g/dL. Platelets: Grade 3, <50.0 - 25.0 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <25.0 x 10^9/L. Leukocytes: Grade 3, <2.0 - 1.0 x 10^9/L; Grade 4, <1.0 x 10^9/L.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormalities (Grade 1 or 2) in Prothrombin Time (PT)
outcome.description: PT is a measure of the clotting ability of the blood. Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1=mild, Grade 2=moderate, Grade 3=severe, Grade 4=life-threatening and 5=death.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. outcome.description: PTT is a measure of the clotting ability of the blood. Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1=mild, Grade 2=moderate, Grade 3=severe, Grade 4=life-threatening and 5=death.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormalities (Grade 1 or 2) in Partial Thromboplastin Time (PTT)
measure.description: PTT is a measure of the clotting ability of the blood. Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1=mild, Grade 2=moderate, Grade 3=severe, Grade 4=life-threatening and 5=death.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST) and Alkaline Phosphatase
outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: ALT, AST and alkaline phosphatase: Grade 3: >5-20 x upper limit of normal (ULN), Grade 4: >20 x ULN.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST) and Alkaline Phosphatase
measure.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: ALT, AST and alkaline phosphatase: Grade 3: >5-20 x upper limit of normal (ULN), Grade 4: >20 x ULN.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Calcium, Potassium, Magnesium and Sodium
outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Calcium: Grade 3-4 : <6.0 – <7.0 or >12.5 – >13.5 mg/dL, Potassium: Grade 3-4 : <2.5 – <3.0 or >6.0 – >7.0 mEq/L, Magnesium: Grade 3-4 : <0.6 - <0.8 or >2.46 - >6.6 mEq/L, Sodium:< 120– 130 or >155 – >160 mEq/L.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Calcium, Potassium, Magnesium and Sodium
measure.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Calcium: Grade 3-4 : <6.0 – <7.0 or >12.5 – >13.5 mg/dL, Potassium: Grade 3-4 : <2.5 – <3.0 or >6.0 – >7.0 mEq/L, Magnesium: Grade 3-4 : <0.6 - <0.8 or >2.46 - >6.6 mEq/L, Sodium:< 120– 130 or >155 – >160 mEq/L.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Creatinine, Bicarbonate, Inorganic Phosphorous and Bilirubin (Total).
outcome.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Creatinine: Grade 3-4 : > 3.0 -6.0 ULN (upper limit of normal),Bicarbonate: Grade 3-4: <16 -<22 mEq/L, Phosphorous: Grade 3-4 : <1.0 - <2.0 mg/dL, Bilirubin, total: Grade 3-4: >3.0 - >10.0 ULN.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout study, from start of study drug therapy up to 30 days after the last dose.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Serum Chemistry Abnormalities in Creatinine, Bicarbonate, Inorganic Phosphorous and Bilirubin (Total).
measure.description: Abnormalities were graded according to the NCI CTC, version 3.0: Grade 1 = mild, Grade 2 = moderate, Grade 3 = severe, Grade 4 = life threatening. Grade 3 and 4 criteria are defined as follows: Creatinine: Grade 3-4 : > 3.0 -6.0 ULN (upper limit of normal),Bicarbonate: Grade 3-4: <16 -<22 mEq/L, Phosphorous: Grade 3-4 : <1.0 - <2.0 mg/dL, Bilirubin, total: Grade 3-4: >3.0 - >10.0 ULN.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Identified Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
outcome.description: ECGs were performed and all recordings were evaluated by the investigator. Abnormalities, if present at any study time point, were listed. The following ECG variables were collected: heart rate, PR interval, QRS width, and QT interval. Abnormalities in ECGs were defined by reference to institutional reports.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 3, 9, 17 and 25, then every 8 weeks until the end of study treatment (up to 17 weeks).

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Identified Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
measure.description: ECGs were performed and all recordings were evaluated by the investigator. Abnormalities, if present at any study time point, were listed. The following ECG variables were collected: heart rate, PR interval, QRS width, and QT interval. Abnormalities in ECGs were defined by reference to institutional reports.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Vital Signs Measurements
outcome.description: Vital signs included systolic and diastolic blood pressure and heart rate. The investigator used his or her judgement to decide whether or not the values were abnormal.
outcome.time_frame: At each study visit (Week 3, 5, 7, 9, 13, 17 and 25) and end of treatment (up to 17 weeks)

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 100 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until progressive disease (PD), defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

group.description: Participants were administered an oral dose of 70 mg dasatinib tablet twice daily for a TDD of 140 mg. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Vital Signs Measurements
measure.description: Vital signs included systolic and diastolic blood pressure and heart rate. The investigator used his or her judgement to decide whether or not the values were abnormal.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All treated participants who were administered a twice-daily oral dose of either 100 mg (TDD 200 mg) or 70 mg (TDD 140 mg) dasatinib tablet. Study treatment continued for as long as it was tolerated, or until PD, defined as appearance of new lesion/s, or >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, relative to the smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start, or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
